column3:
While the landlord shook the Man in the Moon:
‘It’s after three!’ he said.
They rolled the Man slowly up the hill

Fíriel looked out at three o’clock:
the grey night was going;

While the landlord shook the Man-in-the-Moon,
And cried ‘’tis nearly five!’
They rolled him slowly up the hill

earth’s fair daughter.
At eight o’clock in green and white,
with long hair braided,

This essence of the plenilune,
Thirsty, perchance, from dancing all the noon.
